block.p: Elizabeth Tyler Crone and Dr. Daniel Thomas Chrzanowski were married in New York yesterday at the Boathouse Cafe in Central Park, where the Rev. Heather Marie Finck, a Presbyterian minister, performed a nondenominational ceremony.

The bride, 27, is known as Tyler. She was until April a consultant on grants for the Spunk Fund, a foundation for children's health and welfare in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from Brown University and received a master's degree in public health from Columbia University. Ms. Crone, who is keeping her name, will become a student at Yale Law School in September. She is a daughter of Prudence and Walter Crone of Charleston, S.C. The bridegroom, also 27, graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University and received an M.D. last month from Columbia. This month, he is to begin an internship in plastic surgery at the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center. He is the son of Dianne and Daniel Chrzanowski of Cleveland.

Elizabeth Tyler Crone and Dr. Daniel Thomas Chrzanowski were married in New York yesterday at the Boathouse Cafe in Central Park, where the Rev. Heather Marie Finck, a Presbyterian minister, performed a nondenominational ceremony.

The bride, 27, is known as Tyler. She was until April a consultant on grants for the Spunk Fund, a foundation for children's health and welfare in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from Brown University and received a master's degree in public health from Columbia University. Ms. Crone, who is keeping her name, will become a student at Yale Law School in September. She is a daughter of Prudence and Walter Crone of Charleston, S.C. The bridegroom, also 27, graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University and received an M.D. last month from Columbia. This month, he is to begin an internship in plastic surgery at the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center. He is the son of Dianne and Daniel Chrzanowski of Cleveland.

The couple met as members of the rowing crew at Harvard, where the bride spent her first year of college. She was a coxswain; he was an oarsman. After transferring to Brown, Ms. Crone became the captain of the women's crew, which won a national championship in 1996.
